benchmark_details.name: MedAtlas
benchmark_details.overview: MedAtlas is a novel benchmark framework designed to evaluate large language models on realistic medical reasoning tasks. It includes features such as multi-turn dialogue, multi-modal medical image interaction, multi-task integration, and high clinical fidelity, supporting tasks like multi-turn question answering and disease diagnosis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a challenging evaluation platform for advancing the development of robust and trustworthy medical AI.

data.source: The MedAtlas dataset is derived from publicly available medical case repositories and expert clinical case collections.
data.annotation: Expert-annotated gold standards for all tasks

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of answers against ground truth, with specific emphasis on multi-turn reasoning consistency.
methodology.interpretation: A high Round Chain Accuracy indicates effective sequential reasoning across multiple questions.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated models include GPT-4o, Claude-sonnet-4, and LLaMA-4-Maverick, with varied accuracy scores.
